column2: Typhoid Fever, or Slow Fever, is loose in this county.
Epidemic Typhus or Camp Fever, is rampant.
The Dancing Plague, also known as Saint Vitus' dance, is spreading like wildfire amongst the populace. The ailment is possibly caused by ergot poisoning.
This county has suffered an outbreak of Syphilis, a virulent strain of Great Pox brought here by the Aztecs.
The Pale Rider has brought the Black Death to this county.
There is an epidemic of Measles in this county.
Smallpox has struck this county, killing almost half of those infected.
Consumption is an older name for the terrible scourge of Tuberculosis.
